intro: Oreosedum nevadense, commonly known as the Sierra foothill stonecrop, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Oreosedum nevadense thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in open habitats such as slopes, meadows, and along stream banks in its native range.
